description: Schema for submitting metadata for a data file.
title: Data file

external_accession.comment: A file with an external accession should not get an Diabetes Epigenome Atlas accession.

output_type.comment: Files with output_type reads and file format fastq, fatsa, csfasta, csqual and sra require read_length to be specified.

paired_with.comment: Only paired-ended files should have paired_with value.

mapped_read_length.comment: Only bam files can have mapped_read_length specified.

run_type.comment: Only paired-ended files should have paired_end values.

mapped_run_type.comment: Only bam files can have mapped_run_type specified.

paired_end.comment: Files with paired-end value 2 require a paired_with value and files with paired_end specified require run_type to be specified as paired-ended

file_format.comment: Fastq and sra files require run_type and replicate but should not have assembly. Raw data files require platform to be specified. Processed files require assembly to be specified.

status.comment: file_size is required in files with statuses in progress, revoked, archived and released. content_error_details can be specified in files with status deleted and is required in files with the status content error.

___external_accession.description: For files that were not accessioned at our site but have an accession elsewhere.
___external_accession.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.
___external_accession.title: External accession

___status.description: The status of the file object.
___status.comment: Do not submit.  This is set by admins along the process of file submission.
___status.title: Status

___run_type.description: Indicates if file is part of a single or paired end sequencing run
___run_type.comment: This field is required for sra and fastq files.
___run_type.title: Run type for sequencing files

___content_md5sum.description: The MD5sum of the uncompressed file.
___content_md5sum.comment: Do not submit. This is only relavant for gzipped files. This value is calculated and posted by checkfiles script upon submission.
___content_md5sum.title: Content MD5sum

___mapped_read_length.description: The length of the reads actually mapped, if the original read length was clipped.
___mapped_read_length.comment: This is used when the original sequenced read length needed to be adjusted to match a replicate, or to match experiments and controls.
___mapped_read_length.title: Mapped read length

___read_count.description: Number of reads in fastq file.
___read_count.comment: Do not submit. This value is calculated and posted by checkfiles script upon submission.
___read_count.title: Read count

___genome_annotation.description: Genome annotation that file was generated with.
___genome_annotation.comment: Applies to files created using annotations.
___genome_annotation.title: Genome annotation

___bed_file_state.description: Detail description name field in bed file (column 4)
___bed_file_state.comment: This field is required for annotation bed file.
___bed_file_state.title: Name/State for bed file format (column 4)

items.description: Options peak number, cell type, gene name of linked promoter, variant name, chromatin state, gene name of linked binding sites, no assigned name
items.title: State

___flowcell_details.description: For high-throughput sequencing, the flowcells used for the sequencing of the replicate.
___flowcell_details.title: Flowcells

___barcode_position.description: The 1-based start position of the barcode in 5->3 orientation.
___barcode_position.title: Barcode position

___barcode_in_read.description: The read the barcode is located on.
___barcode_in_read.title: Barcode in read

___chunk.description: The file chunk label as assigned by Illumina software when splitting up a fastq into specified chunk sizes.
___chunk.comment: This label is used to re-assemble the chunks into the original file in the correct order.
___chunk.title: Chunk

___machine.description: The lab specific name of the machine used.
___machine.title: Machine Name

___md5sum.description: The md5sum of the file being transferred.
___md5sum.comment: Required. Warning: This value can vary for files of same content gzipped at different times
___md5sum.title: MD5sum

___restricted.description: A flag to indicate whether this file is subject to restricted access
___restricted.comment: Do not submit. This value can only be set by admins.
___restricted.title: Restricted file

___bed_file_value.description: Detail description of score field in bed file (column 5)
___bed_file_value.comment: This field is required for annotaion bed file.
___bed_file_value.title: Value/Score for bed file format (column 5)

items.description: number of samples, peak darkness, co-accesibility score, deltaSVM score, no assigned value
items.title: Value

___paired_with.description: The paired end fastq that corresponds with this file.
___paired_with.comment: This is required for files with paired_end 2 and is calculated for files with paired_end 1.
___paired_with.title: File pairing

___submitted_file_name.description: The local file name used at time of submission.
___submitted_file_name.comment: Although this is not required. It is highly recommended.
___submitted_file_name.title: Original file name

___mapped_run_type.description: The mapped run type of the alignment file which may differ from the fastqs it is derived from.
___mapped_run_type.comment: When the control and experiment run types do not match, one may be changed in order to meet pipeline requirements.
___mapped_run_type.title: Mapped run type for bam files

___read_length.description: For high-throughput sequencing, the number of contiguous nucleotides determined by sequencing.
___read_length.comment: This field is required for fastq, fasta, csfasta, csqual and sra file formats containing sequencing reads.
___read_length.title: Read length

oneOf.comment: Historical file formats, not valid for new submissions.

___file_format_type.description: Files of type bed and gff require further specification
___file_format_type.title: Specific file format type

___date_created.decription: The date the object was created.
___date_created.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is created is assigned by the server.
___date_created.title: Date created

___replicate.description: The experimental replicate designation for the file.
___replicate.comment: This field is required for sra and fastq files. See replicate.json for available identifiers.
___replicate.title: Replicate

___fastq_signature.description: Fastq file flowcell based unique signature to reference a file.
___fastq_signature.comment: Do not submit. This value is calculated and posted by checkfiles script upon submission.
___fastq_signature.title: Fastq file flowcell based signature

items.description: Fastq file flowcell based unique signature to reference a file.
items.comment: Current convention is based on the Illumina unique sequence identifier, colon separated flowcell, lane, read_end(1/2) and barcode.
items.title: Flowcell based fastq siganture part

___dataset.description: The experiment or dataset the file belongs to.
___dataset.comment: Required. See dataset.json for available identifiers.
___dataset.title: Dataset

___derived_from.description: The files participating as inputs into software to produce this output file.
___derived_from.title: Derived from

items.comment: See file.json for a list of available identifiers.

oneOf.comment: Historical file formats, not valid for new submissions.

___assembly.description: Genome assembly that files were mapped to.
___assembly.comment: Required property for bam, sam, gtf, gff, bed and bigBed file format files. This property should not be submitted with sra or fastq files.
___assembly.title: Mapping assembly

___content_error_detail.description: Explanation of why the file failed the automated content checks.
___content_error_detail.comment: Do not submit.  This is posted by the checkfiles script. It is required when status is 'content error'
___content_error_detail.title: Content error detail

___controlled_by.description: The files which should be used as a control for this file.
___controlled_by.comment: This is used by the pipeline to find ChIP-seq controls.
___controlled_by.title: Controlled by

items.comment: See file.json for a list of available identifiers.

___dbxrefs.comment: Do not submit.  This is for admins to make virtual file objcts for files at external resources.
___dbxrefs.title: External identifiers

items.description: A unique identifier from external resource.
items.title: External identifier

enum: peaks and background as input for IDR
minus strand signal of all reads
plus strand signal of all reads
minus strand signal of unique reads
plus strand signal of unique reads

oneOf.comment: Historical output types, not valid for new submissions.

___output_type.description: A description of the file's purpose or contents.
___output_type.title: Output type

___supersedes.description: The files that this file supersedes.
___supersedes.comment: The files in this list should be obsolete and the superseeding file object should be used instead.
___supersedes.title: Supersedes

items.comment: The files in this list should be archived or revoked.

___platform.description: The measurement device used to collect data.
___platform.comment: This field is required for csfasta, csqual, rcc, idat and CEL file formats. See platform.json for identifer format.
___platform.title: Platform

___file_format_specifications.description: Text or .as files the further explain the file format
___file_format_specifications.title: File format specifications documents

items.comment: See document.json for a list of available identifiers.

___paired_end.description: Which read of the pair the file represents (in case of paired end sequencing run)
___paired_end.comment: This field is required if run_type is paired-ended.
___paired_end.title: Paired End Identifier

___step_run.description: The run instance of the step used to generate the file.
___step_run.comment: This may be linked to an individual instance at DNANexus or it may be virtual and have many files linked to it.
___step_run.title: Analysis step run
